author: Friday
title: Unprecedented Flooding Displaces Hundreds Of Thousands Across East Africa
text:
Unprecedented Flooding Displaces Hundreds Of Thousands Across East Africa
“Unprecedented and devastating” flooding in East Africa has triggered widespread displacement with hundreds of thousands forced from their homes in Burundi, Kenya, Rwanda, Somalia, Ethiopia and Tanzania, UN humanitarians warned on Wednesday.
In an alert, the International
Organization for Migration (
IOM) noted that
torrential rains have unleashed catastrophic flooding and
mudslides while also severely damaging roads, bridges and
dams.
More than 637,000 people have been affected by weeks of deluges, including 234,000 displaced in just the last five days. There is no official figure for the number of dead.
Never-ending emergency
“The numbers [of displaced people] keep rising,” the UN agency said, noting that the flooding emergency was one of the “harsh realities” of climate change, which has claimed lives and uprooted entire communities.
“As these individuals face the daunting task of rebuilding, their vulnerability only deepens,” said Rana Jaber, IOM's regional director.
“In this critical moment, even as IOM responds, the call remains urgent for sustainable efforts to address human mobility spurred by a changing climate,” she continued.
Africa is highly vulnerable to climate change despite contributing only about four per cent to global greenhouse gas emissions. The eastern and Horn of Africa areas have particularly been impacted by alternating cycles of drought and intense precipitation over the last decade, IOM maintained.
Amid the worst rains and flooding in decades, IOM along with governments and partners continue to provide lifesaving assistance to affected populations who have lost family members and now face a heightened risk of waterborne disease.
In Burundi, IOM has distributed emergency shelter, blankets, cooking utensils, solar lamps, dignity kits and other items to more than 5,000 people. The UN agency also supports the relocation of people at risk to safe and less flood-prone areas.
Help is also underway in neighbouring Ethiopia to more than 70,000 flood-affected people across Somali and Oromia regions and to 39,000 people in Kenya’s most severely flood-affected east, centre and west and in Somalia, where some 240,000 people are to receive shelter materials, hygiene kits, essential medical care and psychosocial support, among other services.
Climate talks imperative
Ahead of UN-led discussions in Germany in June to tackle climate change, IOM said it was increasingly “evident” that any discussions on our warming planet and its impact on the environment should now include considerations of human mobility and displacement.
East African leaders have already
signed and committed to the Kampala Ministerial
Declaration on Migration, Environment and Climate
Change to address the “challenges and the
opportunities of climate mobility”, IOM said, but greater
efforts are needed to support its implementation,
“including advocating for the inclusion of climate
mobility at global climate discussions" such as the upcoming
UN Climate Change Conference (
COP29) in November 2024,
taking place in Baku,
Azerbaijan.

author: @heykarthikm
title: Google finally adds ability to search the web on NotebookLM
text:
NotebookLM, arguably one of Google’s most slept-on AI products, just got a pretty powerful update — web search integration. If you're not familiar with it, NotebookLM is Google’s AI-powered notebook that works off your own stuff, including PDFs, Google Docs, Slides, websites, and more. You can feed it your sources, and it helps you generate summaries, briefings, FAQs, and now, curated search results.
The new feature is called Discover Sources, and it basically lets you search the web directly from inside your notebook. When a user describes their topic, NotebookLM scans through hundreds of web sources in seconds. It picks out up to 10 of the most relevant ones, complete with annotated summaries that explain why each source might matter to your topic. With just a single click, you can pull them into your notebook and add them as part of your sources.
To try it:
- Go to
notebooklm.google.com - Open up a notebook.
- In the Sources panel, tap the Discover button.
- Describe what you’re interested in.
This isn’t the only upgrade. Earlier this year, NotebookLM added YouTube video support, where you can paste a public video URL, and it becomes part of your source stack. You can get summaries and citations and view the video in an embedded player. Google also added support for Audio Overview to NotebookLM, which turns documents, charts, slides, etc., into narrated AI audio briefings that can be shared with others as well.
NotebookLM is available for both regular users and organizations. If you're in an EDU or enterprise setup, Workspace admins can enable it domain-wide.
NotebookLM still feels like one of Google’s most underrated and underused tools. It can be helpful, especially for students, writers, analysts, or anyone dealing with messy research. With updates like this, it’s starting to look like something that could actually change how we do research with AI.
Source: Google
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: The Star Online
title: Boeing workers going on strike after 96% vote for walkout | The Star
text:
Aviation Friday, 13 Sep 2024
2:47 PM MYT Related News World 1d ago Kenyan aviation workers call off strike after reaching deal World 1d ago Kenya aviation workers' union ends strike, union official says Indonesia 08 Sep 2024 Indonesia advances aviation sustainability efforts to achieve greener skies FILE PHOTO: The Boeing logo is seen on the side of a Boeing 737 MAX at the Farnborough International Airshow, in Farnborough, Britain, July 20, 2022. REUTERS/Peter Cziborra/File Photo
Boeing's U.S. West Coast factory workers will walk off the job after 96% voted on Thursday in favor of a strike, halting production of the planemaker's strongest-selling jet as it wrestles with chronic output delays and mounting debt.
The workers' first strike since 2008 will start at midnight Pacific time (0700 GMT) as Friday begins, just weeks after new CEO Kelly Ortberg was brought on in August to restore faith in the planemaker after a door panel blew off a near-new 737 MAX jet in mid-air in January.
Roughly 30,000 workers who produce Boeing's 737 MAX and other jets in the Seattle and Portland areas voted on their first full contract in 16 years.
International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM) members voted 96% in favor of striking and 94.6% to reject the agreement.
"This is about respect, this is about addressing the past, and this is about fighting for our future," said Jon Holden, who headed the negotiations for IAM, Boeing's largest union, before announcing the vote result.
"We strike at midnight," he said, as members in the union hall cheered and chanted: "Strike! Strike! Strike!"
Boeing said late on Thursday the vote sent a clear message that the tentative deal it had reached with IAM leadership was not acceptable to members.
"We remain committed to resetting our relationship with our employees and the union, and we are ready to get back to the table to reach a new agreement," the planemaker said in a statement.
The deal included a general wage increase of 25%, a $3,000 signing bonus and a pledge to build Boeing's next commercial jet in the Seattle area, provided the program was launched within the four years of the contract.
Although IAM leadership recommended last Sunday that its members accept the contract, many workers had responded angrily, arguing for the originally demanded 40% pay rise and lamenting the loss of an annual bonus.
"We're going to get back to the table as quickly as we can," Holden told reporters, without saying how long he thought the strike would last or when talks would resume. "This is something that we take one day at a time, one week at a time.”
Workers have been protesting all week in Boeing factories in the Seattle area that assemble Boeing's MAX, 777 and 767 jets.
Boeing shares closed up 0.9% on Thursday before the vote results were announced but are down 36% this year on concerns over safety, production and a $60 billion debt burden.
The duration of the walkout is not clear. A long strike would weigh not only on Boeing's financials, but on airlines that depend on the planemaker’s jets and suppliers who manufacture parts and components for its aircraft.
According to a pre-vote note from TD Cowen, a 50-day strike could cost Boeing an estimated $3 billion to $3.5 billion of cash flow.
The Boeing workers' last strike in 2008 shuttered plants for 52 days and hit revenue by an estimated $100 million per day.
S&P Global Ratings said that an extended strike could delay the planemaker's recovery and hurt its overall rating. Both S&P and Moody's rate Boeing one notch above junk status.
The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment. - Reuters
Open Modal × Follow us on our official WhatsApp channel for breaking news alerts and key updates! Tags / Keywords: Boeing , factory , strike , jet , debt

author: Marco Vito Oddo
title: In ‘The Boys’ Season 4, conspiracy theories work just like in the real world
text:
Even if
The Boys is known for its bloody take on superheroes, the show often does a fantastic job with political parody. In Season 4, The Boys perfectly summarizes why conspiracy theories are so popular.
The first three episodes of The Boys Season 4, now available on Amazon’s Prime Video, follow the black ops team as they try to learn more about Homelander’s (Antony Starr) dangerous new plan. After killing a civilian in public, Vought’s mightiest superhero has decided to play the political game in broad daylight instead of hiding in the shadows. To do that, Homelander enlists Sister Sage (Susan Heyward), the most intelligent person on the planet.
While following Sage, the Boys end up at Truthcon, a convention dedicated to conspiracy theories. The episode makes fun of some of the most popular conspiracy theories, such as Flat Earth and Lizard People. However, it also takes time to explain why many people dedicate their lives to conspiracy theories.
The Boys uses Firecracker to explain the appeal of conspiracy theories
Sister Sage is at Truthcon to enlist Firecracker (Valorie Curry), the head of a podcast named Truthbomb. In her podcast, Firecracker promises to reveal the “truth” about Starlight (Erin Moriarty) to hundreds of followers. As expected, that “truth” is just a bunch of nonsense about how Starlight helps multiple Hollywood figures find underaged sex slaves.
Firecracker’s audience applauds her supposed courage to talk about what the media “hides” from the U.S. citizens, and her words make Homelander followers angrier against Starlighters. It’s easy to understand why Sister Sage wants to bring Firecracker onboard her plan, as she aims to increase the schism between the two sides of the polarized political landscape.
Sister Sage doesn’t care what Firecracker truly thinks; the podcaster is just another pawn in her dangerous game. Yet, Sage still pressures Firecracker to admit she’s making up stories to increase her audience numbers. Firecracker eventually tells Sage the truth, underlining how she’s selling “purpose.” That is a powerful line that perfectly summarizes real-world conspiracy theorists.
From the outside, it’s easy to see conspiracy theories are mostly fabricated gibberish. It’s even easier to make fun of whoever believes in these twisted discourses. However, Firecracker knows that people hold tight to conspiracy theories because their world doesn’t make sense anymore.
Conspiracy theories offer individuals the opportunity to regain a sense of control over their own lives. The economy is in shambles, people struggle to put food on their tables and have a roof over their heads, the environment is being destroyed by a handful of greedy corporations, and billionaires increase their profit margins every day. It’s hard to be hopeful about the future and feel that your actions matter in the long run. So, conspiracy theories give a straightforward answer that people can use to pin the blame for everything on a particular group of enemies that must be destroyed at all costs.
Furthermore, conspiracy theories are also incredibly popular with more conservatives because the world feels even more chaotic to them. People who hold tight to archaic ideas of gender, sexuality, and race feel less at home in a world that’s progressively becoming more accepting of differences. That’s why so many conspiracy theories paint minorities as villains, as this gives a sense of comfort and allows them to reinterpret the world through the lenses they are used to wearing.
There are whole communities built around conspiracy theories, safe spaces where disoriented people can find structure and genuine human bonds — or, as Firecracker puts it, purpose. That’s why it’s so hard to dismantle conspiracist groups, especially since most people prefer to see these people as lunatics who should be joked about. This attitude only increases the abysm between “us” and “them,” ultimately making society more hostile and pushing even more people to search for purpose in conspiracy theories.
It’s impressive that The Boys has such clarity about the workings of conspiracy theories. Since 4 echoes the bipartisan division of U.S. politics, it would be easier just to pick a side and paint the other one as simply evil and dumb. Yet, Season 4 genuinely tries to understand what makes people believe in the most farfetched stories ever, and how power-hungry media figures use conservatism to make money. It’s not enough to bash conspiracy theorists; it’s equally essential to recognize how the lack of perspective facilitates the choice for extremism.

author: @WGEM
title: Winter Weather conditions causes safety hazards for drivers
text: Winter Weather conditions causes safety hazards for drivers QUINCY (WGEM) - Winter weather has made roads and bridges across the Tri-States very slippery which has led to several accidents already. Drivers often get in a hurry and are not paying attention on the road causing a lot of accidents around this time of year. Winter weather conditions can cause a variety of safety hazards for drivers. “As soon as it drops to 32 degrees or right in that area with a little bit of mist and rain we had last night it’s going to make icy spots,” said Canton Fire Chief Joe LaCount. Taking extra precautions when those conditions arrive in the Tri-states can make a big difference. “So that makes it harder to drive in and as always visibility is lower at times so you got to be more cautious and paying attention to people around you and what’s going on,” said Adams County Sheriff’s Office Deputy Logan Peter. Officials said during the winter, it’s best to give yourself plenty of driving time to ensure your safety. “When the temperature drops its best to drop your speed a little and really pay attention to the road conditions ahead of you,” LaCount said. Bridges and overpasses are also very dangerous during winter weather conditions since icy spots can be difficult for drivers to see. “Cold air can often get under the roadway there and it causes the moisture on the road to freeze so they’ll freeze before other parts of the roadway will,” Peter said. “So when you’re on the highway and you come out from underneath an overpass or bridge the roads can change really quickly right there,” LaCount said. To avoid any accidents you should plan you trips ahead of time and always be sure to check the weather conditions before you leave. “Give yourself an extra few minutes to get to where you’re going, leave in plenty of time and expect to need to drive slower to where you’re going,” Peter said. First responders advise drivers to make sure vehicles get regularly serviced and prepped for winter weather conditions before driving to ensure smoother travels. Copyright 2023 WGEM. All rights reserved.

author: world today news
title: Vivo Y39 5G Unveiled: Discover the 120Hz Display, Snapdragon 4 Gen 2, and 6,500mAh Battery Power!
text:
“`html
Vivo Y39 5G Officially released: 120Hz Display , Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 , and Massive 6500mAh Battery
The Vivo Y39 5G has officially launched, presenting a compelling blend of style and functionality. This new device features a sleek design, a vibrant display with a smooth 120Hz refresh rate, and a substantial battery capacity, positioning it as a strong contender in the competitive mid-range smartphone market. Available in two attractive colors, Ocean Blue and Galaxy Purple, the Vivo Y39 5G aims to capture the attention of users seeking a balance of performance and aesthetics. Weighing approximately 205 grams and measuring 165.7 x 76.3 x 8.09 mm, the phone strikes a balance between a large screen and comfortable handling.
The Vivo Y39 5G aims to make a splash in the mid-range market with its impressive specifications. The combination of a high refresh rate display, a power-efficient processor, and a long-lasting battery sets it apart from many competitors.The phone’s design also contributes to its appeal, offering a modern look and feel that is sure to attract attention.With its competitive price point, the Vivo Y39 5G is poised to become a popular choice for consumers looking for a feature-rich smartphone without breaking the bank.
Immersive Display and Durable Design The vivo Y39 5G boasts a 6.68-inch LCD panel with a resolution of 1608 x 720 pixels .While the resolution is modest, the inclusion of a 120Hz refresh rate significantly enhances the user experience. This high refresh rate makes scrolling and gaming feel noticeably smoother and more responsive, providing a more fluid and enjoyable interaction with the device. The display aims to deliver a visually pleasing experience, even with its lower resolution, by prioritizing smoothness and responsiveness.
Adding to its appeal, the Vivo Y39 5G comes with IP64 certification. This rating indicates that the device is protected against dust and splashes of water, providing users with added peace of mind in everyday situations. This feature enhances the phone’s durability and makes it a practical choice for users who are often on the go, ensuring that the device can withstand the rigors of daily use. The IP64 rating is a valuable addition, offering a degree of protection that is often lacking in other mid-range smartphones.
Performance and Processing Power under the hood, the vivo Y39 5G is powered by the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 chipset, built on a 4nm process. This processor is designed to deliver efficient and reliable performance, making it suitable for a wide range of tasks, from everyday browsing to more demanding applications. The 4nm architecture contributes to improved power efficiency, helping to extend battery life and reduce heat generation. The Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 is a capable processor that provides a smooth and responsive user experience.
The device is equipped with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of internal storage. This combination provides ample space for storing apps, photos, videos, and other files. Furthermore,the generous amount of RAM ensures smooth multitasking,allowing users to switch between apps seamlessly without experiencing lag. The ample storage and RAM contribute to the overall performance and usability of the device, making it a practical choice for users who need to store a lot of data and run multiple apps concurrently.
Vivo has also incorporated a Virtual RAM feature,which allows users to expand the RAM capacity by adding several gigabytes. This feature can further enhance multitasking capabilities, especially when running multiple resource-intensive applications concurrently. The Virtual RAM feature is a valuable addition that can improve the performance of the device, especially when running demanding applications.
The Vivo Y39 5G runs on Android 15,customized with the Funtouch OS 15 interface. This combination provides users with access to the latest Android features and enhancements, along with Vivo’s own unique set of customizations and optimizations. The Funtouch OS 15 interface offers a user-pleasant experience with a variety of customization options.
Battery life and Charging Capabilities One of the standout features of the Vivo Y39 5G is its massive 6,500mAh battery. This large battery capacity ensures that users can get through a full day of heavy use without needing to recharge. Whether you’re browsing the web, streaming videos, or playing games, the Vivo Y39 5G is designed to keep up with your demands. The large battery capacity is a major selling point for the device, offering users the freedom to use their phone without worrying about running out of power.
To complement its remarkable battery life, the Vivo Y39 5G supports 44W fast charging technology. This fast charging capability allows users to quickly replenish the battery, minimizing downtime and ensuring that the phone is always ready to go. According to tests, the 44W fast charging can charge the device from 1% to 100% in approximately 83 minutes. The fast charging technology is a valuable addition that allows users to quickly recharge their device when needed.
With its long-lasting battery and fast charging capabilities, the Vivo Y39 5G is an ideal choice for users who value mobility and need a device that can keep up with their fast-paced lifestyles. The combination of a large battery and fast charging makes the device a practical choice for users who are always on the go.
The Vivo Y39 5G offers a compelling package of features, including a smooth 120Hz display, a capable Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor, ample RAM and storage, and a massive 6,500mAh battery with fast charging. Available in Ocean Blue and Galaxy Purple, this device is well-suited for users who are looking for a reliable and feature-rich smartphone at a competitive price point.The Vivo Y39 5G aims to deliver a premium experience without breaking the bank, making it a strong contender in the mid-range smartphone market.
Vivo Y39 5G: A Giant Leap for Mid-Range Smartphones? An Exclusive Interview Is the Vivo Y39 5G poised to disrupt the mid-range smartphone market, or is it just another incremental upgrade? Let’s find out.
Interviewer (Senior Editor, world-today-news.com): Dr. Anya Sharma, a leading expert in mobile technology and consumer electronics, welcome to world-today-news.com. The recently launched Vivo Y39 5G boasts a compelling array of features—a 120Hz display, a sizeable 6500mAh battery, and the Snapdragon 4 gen 2 processor. what truly sets this device apart from its competitors in the crowded mid-range segment?
The Vivo Y39 ‌5G’s success hinges not on a single standout feature, but on a synergistic blend of capabilities typically found in higher-priced devices. The combination of a high refresh​ rate ⁢display,notable battery capacity,and a power-efficient processor at a competitive price point is what truly makes‌ it disruptive. Many mid-range phones excel in one area, but the Y39 5G aims for balanced excellence across key performance indicators.
Dr. Anya Sharma, Mobile Technology Expert
The Power of a High Refresh Rate Display Interviewer: The 120Hz refresh rate is a notable feature. How meaningful is this for the average consumer, considering the relatively modest 720p resolution?
The 120Hz refresh rate is a game changer, especially for everyday use.​ While the resolution ⁤isn’t the highest, the smoother scrolling and more responsive interface significantly enhance the user experience. This is especially noticeable when browsing social media, gaming, or simply navigating the phone’s menus. Think of it like the difference​ between watching a film at 24 frames⁢ per second versus 60 or ​120—the smoothness is far more ⁣impactful than many realise. The improved responsiveness⁤ also benefits users with dexterity challenges or those who prefer a more fluid and less laggy interaction.
Dr. Anya Sharma, Mobile Technology Expert
Long-Lasting Battery Life and Fast Charging: A Winning Combination Interviewer: The 6500mAh battery is undeniably notable.How does this compare to the battery life of competing devices,and what are the practical implications for daily use?
The 6500mAh battery is a considerable advantage. Many mid-range phones struggle to last a full day on a single charge, especially with intensive usage. The Vivo Y39 5G, though, provides remarkable battery endurance , allowing for several hours of continuous screen-on time. this translates to peace of mind for users—knowing that they can use their device throughout the day for work, entertainment, and dialog without worrying about running out of power. The addition of 44W fast charging further enhances this, significantly reducing charging time. This combination of extended battery life and rapid charging addresses a key frustration for smartphone users.
Dr. Anya Sharma, Mobile Technology Expert
Processor Performance and Multitasking Capabilities Interviewer: The snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor is also a significant component. How does its performance compare to other processors in this price range, and how does the inclusion of virtual RAM aid in multitasking?
The Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 offers a substantial performance improvement over its predecessors. Its 4nm architecture contributes to improved energy efficiency, translating into longer battery life and less heat generation. For everyday tasks like browsing, social media, and streaming, the performance is quite smooth. The inclusion of virtual RAM enhances the device’s multitasking prowess, allowing smooth transition between apps even when running multiple resource-intensive applications concurrently. This feature is especially useful for users who regularly juggle multiple apps,such as those who use their phones for work or personal projects. For example, it enables seamless switching between email, messaging, and video conferencing.
Dr. Anya Sharma, Mobile Technology Expert
Durability and Design Considerations Interviewer: The Vivo Y39 5G boasts IP64 certification. How relevant is this feature to the average user, and what does it indicate about the phone’s overall design?
IP64 certification indicates protection against dust ingress and water splashes. While it doesn’t guarantee full submersion protection, this level of durability offers peace of mind for everyday use. It means the phone can withstand accidental spills or exposure to dust without significant damage
Vivo Y39 5G: A Game Changer for the mid-Range Market? An Exclusive Interview Is the Vivo Y39 5G truly a disruptive force in the mid-range smartphone arena, or simply another iterative upgrade? Let’s delve into the details.
Interviewer (Senior Editor, world-today-news.com): Dr. Anya Sharma, a leading expert in mobile technology and consumer electronics, welcome to world-today-news.com. The recently launched Vivo Y39 5G boasts an remarkable array of features—a 120Hz display, a considerable 6500mAh battery, and the Snapdragon 4 gen 2 processor. Dr. Sharma: The Vivo Y39 5G’s success story isn’t about a single, impressive feature, but rather a harmonious blend of capabilities usually reserved for premium-priced smartphones. The combination of a high refresh rate display, meaningful battery capacity, and a power-efficient processor, all offered at a competitive price point, is what truly positions it as disruptive. Many mid-range phones excel in one area, but the Y39 5G strives for balanced excellence across several key performance metrics. This holistic approach is what sets it apart.
The Power of a High Refresh Rate Display Interviewer: The 120Hz refresh rate is a notable addition. How impactful is this for the average consumer, given the relatively modest 720p resolution?
Dr. Sharma: The 120Hz refresh rate is transformative, especially for everyday tasks.while the resolution isn’t the highest on the market, the smoother scrolling and more responsive interface considerably enhance the user experience. This is particularly noticeable when engaging with social media, gaming, or simply navigating the phone’s menus. Think of it like the difference between watching a film at 24 frames per second versus 60 or 120—the smoothness is far more impactful then many realize. The improved responsiveness also benefits users with dexterity challenges or those who prefer a noticeably more fluid and less laggy interaction with thier device.
Long-Lasting Battery Life and fast Charging: A Winning Combination Interviewer: The 6500mAh battery is undeniably a standout feature. How does its performance compare to competing devices, and what practical implications does this have for daily use?
Dr. Sharma: The 6500mAh battery provides a considerable advantage. Many mid-range phones struggle to last a full day on a single charge,especially with demanding usage patterns. However, the Vivo Y39 5G offers exceptional battery endurance , providing users with several hours of continuous screen-on time. This translates to peace of mind—users can confidently utilize their device throughout the day for work,leisure,and interaction without the anxiety of depleting battery power. The inclusion of 44W fast charging further amplifies this benefit,significantly reducing charging time. This winning combination of extended battery life and rapid charging directly addresses a primary source of frustration for smartphone users.
Processor performance and Multitasking Capabilities Interviewer: The Snapdragon 4 gen 2 processor is another key component. How does its performance compare to other processors in this price bracket, and how does the addition of virtual RAM enhance multitasking?
Dr. Sharma: The Snapdragon 4 gen 2 offers a considerable performance boost over its predecessors. Its 4nm architecture contributes to superior energy efficiency, resulting in extended battery life and reduced heat generation. For everyday tasks like browsing, social media engagement, and streaming, the performance is remarkably smooth.The integration of virtual RAM significantly enhances the device’s multitasking capabilities, enabling seamless transitions between applications even when running several resource-intensive programs concurrently. This feature is especially beneficial for users who frequently juggle various apps, such as those using their smartphones for professional purposes or personal projects. For instance, it ensures effortless switching between email, messaging, and video conferencing.
Durability and Design Considerations Interviewer: The Vivo Y39 5G boasts IP64 certification. How relevant is this feature to the average user, and what does it suggest about the phone’s overall design philosophy?
Dr. sharma: IP64 certification signifies protection against dust intrusion and water splashes. Although it doesn’t guarantee complete submersion protection, this level of durability offers valuable peace of mind for everyday utilization. It means the phone can withstand accidental spills or exposure to dust without sustaining significant damage. This demonstrates a commitment to robust build quality and thoughtful design, exceeding expectations frequently enough associated with mid-range devices.It reflects a broader commitment to creating a more durable, long-lasting product.
Interviewer: Dr. Sharma, thank you for your insightful commentary. It’s clear the Vivo Y39 5G represents a significant advancement in the mid-range smartphone market.
Dr. Sharma: My pleasure. The Vivo Y39 5G’s success stems from its balanced approach; prioritizing essential features like battery life, processing power, and display responsiveness without compromising affordability. This suggests a significant shift in what consumers can expect from this crucial sector of the smartphone market.
What are your thoughts on the Vivo Y39 5G’s feature set? Share your opinions in the comments below!

author: R Kaushik
title: SA put India in their pace!
text: The capitulation was abject, the surrender complete. Having come to South Africa entertaining visions of finally securing a Test series win in the only country where it has remained elusive so far, Indias hopes were buried just three days into the series at SuperSport Park on Thursday. Having seen Dean Elgar and Marco Jansen extend South Africas first-innings advantage in the first Test to a commanding 163, India faced the daunting task of batting with application and purpose if they were to make a match of it. Instead, in a lacklustre display totally out of sync with their standing as the No. 1 Test side, India rolled over for just 131 in 34.1 overs in the second innings, well beaten by an innings and 32 runs with more than two days remaining. Also Read:India slump to their biggest defeat on South African soil in Test history SAs Nandre Burger celebrates KL Rahuls wicket yesterday. Pic/Getty Images Kohli wages lone battle Even South Africa must have been pleasantly surprised at the rapidity with which Indias batsmen departed the crease, in unseemly hurry as strokes were played with gay abandon. Virat Kohlis stylish 76 was no more than a consolation, the top-order fired out as much because of their adventurism as the discipline of the South African bowling. As is to be expected, there were a clutch of excellent deliveries, including the one from Kagiso Rabada in the third over that slanted into Rohit Sharma and seamed away on pitching to hit off-stump, but there were also outlandish strokes with no respect for the game situation or the conditions. South Africa put down two catches, including off the first delivery of the Indian second innings when Aiden Markram failed to grab an offering low to his right at first slip off Yashasvi Jaiswal. Yet, India continued to look a gift horse in the mouth, failing to tread the thin line between aggression and indiscretion judiciously. Debutant Burger claims four That only two batsmen, Kohli and Shubman Gill, topped double digits must also be a source of worry. South Africas pace battery did just about enough, but they didnt need to do more, not with India in such generous wicket-surrendering mode after having seen the opposition pile on the runs. Nandre Burger, who had an excellent debut, finished with four wickets while Jansen added to his career-best unbeaten 84 with a three-wicket burst including the scalps with identical full balls of Gill and Shreyas Iyer. Jansen had taken the lead role in the morning when South Africa resumed at 256 for five in reply to Indias 245. The game was still in the balance but there was no joy for Indias bowlers as the sixth-wicket alliance burgeoned to 111. Jasprit Bumrah was tireless and unflagging and R Ashwin asked tricky questions on a seam-friendly surface, but the other pacers again disappointed, too full or too short and mercilessly punished. Elgars seven-and-a-quarter-hour vigil that fetched him 185 was finally ended by Shardul Thakur. India finished well short of that tally in their second dig, comprehensively schooled by the hosts. Brief scoresIndia 245 & 131 all out (V Kohli 76; N Burger 4-33, M Jansen 3-36, K Rabada 2-32) lost to South Africa 408 (D Elgar 185, M Jansen 84*, D Bedingham 56; J Bumrah 4-69, M Siraj 2-91) by an innings and 32 runs

author: Jordi Gil
title: Resumen del Serbia - España | Los campeones arrancan a buen ritmo, aunque sin gol en Belgrado
text: Los campeones arrancan a buen ritmo, aunque sin gol en Belgrado La selección española avasalló a Serbia en el segundo tiempo, pero las buenas jugadas, sobre todo de Lamine Yamal, no recibieron premio España arrancó con un punto en Belgrado en el estreno de la nueva edición de la UEFA Nations League. El equipo dejó otra vez una impresión muy positiva, aunque en esta ocasión no tuvo la magia de acertar ante la meta contraria para llevarse la merecida victoria De la Fuente se decantó por Dani Olmo en la media punta y Pedri se quedó en el banquillo. [Lamine, recuperado de su golpe, y Nico Williams tuvieron en esta ocasión a Ayoze como referencia](/deportes/2024/09/04/fuente-lamine-golpe-jugar-serbia-107757949.html) ofensiva con la baja de Morata. El otro cambio obligado por sanción y cantado fue el de Zubimendi por Rodri. Serbia salió con su habitual sistema de tres centrales y con una brutal pitada al técnico Dragan Stojkovic de una afición aún dolida por la tempranera eliminación en la Eurocopa. La media entrada que se registró en el 'Pequeño Marakaná' fue la mejor muestra del desencanto con la selección. Los precedentes, sin embargo, no son un barómetro preciso en el inicio de una nueva temporada y ni el campeón de Europa podía confiarse ni los serbios tirar la toalla antes de empezar. Aunque España salió dominando y controlando el balón, Serbia pudo marcar nada más empezar en un veloz contragolpe desbaratado en última instancia por Laporte y un lanzamiento desviado encima de la portería de David Raya. La Roja debía imponer su estilo, aunque vio pronto que tampoco debía desprotegerse. Pese a ello, Carvajal sufría por la derecha y Jovic dispuso de la segunda ocasión local. Jovic perdona la más clara La Roja debía mejorar su juego plano ofensivo y tratar de ser más vertical. Lamine Yamal y Nico Williams eran las válvulas de escape frente a un rival que tenía claro su plan: defender muy juntos y salir a la contra. Con los extremos más participativos y un Dani Olmo omnipresente llegó la primera oportunidad española con una volea alta de Carvajal. Lamine y Nico se activaron y Serbia empezó a sufrir. Sus disparos empezaron a llegar y meter el miedo en el cuerpo aún más a sus rivales. Entre el azulgrana y Olmo fabricaron una jugada preciosa con remate final de Ayoze detenido por Rajkovic. La réplica fue inmediata con Jovic y Le Normand rompiendo el fuera de juego, fallando de forma increíble solo ante Raya. El partido se animó y Fabián cruzó la pelota en medio de la locura. El medio tiempo sirvió para calmar los ánimos a un partido muy disputado, con cinco amarillas solo en 45 minutos. Sin tregua El alto ritmo continuó en el segundo tiempo con una falta lanzada por Ilic al lateral de la red. Serbia se lo creía y veía que cada vez que aceleraba creaba peligro. De la Fuente contestó con cambios de calidad situando a Grimaldo y Oyarzabal. Las sustituciones dieron aire a España para frenar los arreones balcánicos. Grimaldo dejó su sella que obligó a volar a Rajkovic, con rechace posterior para Lamine, quien acarició el gol con su rosca. España se sentía por fin superior al rival y se veía con más opciones de ganar. El ex portero del Mallorca se volvió a lucir frente al blaugrana y Fabián perdonó en el área pequeña tras una recuperación del de Rocafonda. De la Fuente quería ganar y situó a Pedri para los últimos minutos. El equipo estaba volcado y solo faltaba tener mayor claridad en el área contraria. Con el juego solo en campo serbio, el de la rioja subió su apuesta con dos hombres de área como Joselu y Ferran. El ex madridista pudo ser víctima de un penalti nada más entrar. Los últimos balones centrados al área no tuvieron recompensa y España se tuvo que conformar con un punto que puede mejorar si el domingo gana en Suiza. Ficha técnica Serbia: Rajkovic, Erakovic (Simic, 45'), Milenkovic, Pavlovic, Nedejkovic, Ilic (Mitrovic, 85'), Lukic, Birmancevic, Samardzic (Grujic, 74'), Zivkovic (Belic, 63') y Jovic (Ratkov, 74') España: Raya, Carvajal, Le Normand, Laporte, Cucurella (Grimaldo, 57'), Zubimendi, Fabián (Pedri, 77'), Lamine Yamal, Olmo (Ferran Torres, 81'), Nico Williams (Joselu, 81') y Ayoze (Oyarzabal, 57') Árbitro: Serdar Gözübüyük. TA: Erakovic (5'), Birmancevic (44'), Belic (70') / Ayoze (22'), Carvajal (27'), Lamine (41'), Laporte (46'), Le Normand (59'), Olmo (67'), De la Fuente (85') Estadio: Rajko Mitić, 30.000 espectadores author: @14News
title: Hopkins Co. teacher honored by SBO+ Magazine
text:
Hopkins Co. teacher honored by SBO+ Magazine
EVANSVILLE, Ind. (WFIE) - Hopkins County Schools teacher David Moss has been selected to represent Kentucky in the SBO+ magazine issue featuring 50 Music Teachers Who Make a Difference.
According to a press release, Moss teaches at both West Hopkins School and Hopkins County Central High School.
He is the band director at WHS and an assistant at HCCHS.
This award highlights music educators who go above and beyond to make a difference in the lives of students and their communities through music.
Moss says he doesn’t know who nominated him but wants to thank the person who did.
He previously received this award once before in 2006. This is the 25th year SBO+ has released this special edition.
“I am grateful to be recognized by SBO Magazine, but the real difference makers are the students, parents, and colleagues that I get to work with on a daily basis that make my job the best in HCS,” Moss said. “I wake up every day grateful I am given the opportunity to make a difference in our part of Hopkins County.”
The December issue was released this week.
Copyright 2024 WFIE. All rights reserved.

author: Times Of India
title: BJP: Bjp Dividing Tribal Society On Religious Lines: Sarkar | Agartala News - Times of India
text: AGARTALA: After TIPRA Motha, former chief minister and CPM politburo member Manik Sarkar hit out at the BJP accusing it of creating division in tribal society on religious lines while criticising the move of Janajati Suraksha Mancha (JSM) to scrap ST benefits of converted tribals.Addressing party cadres here on Thursday, Sarkar said, “The rally JSM held two days ago was a new beginning to disintegrate tribals. The seeds of religious division are being sown in the tribal communities and innocent brothers and sisters living in the hilly areas are being misguided once again.”Slamming TIPRA Motha party for playing second fiddle to the ruling BJP in the recently held assembly elections, he said, “They (JSM) are not much different from TIPRA Motha. What happened in the last assembly elections, TIPRA Motha maintained a clandestine relation with the BJP and remained vocal against its policies in public.”Sarkar said TIPRA Motha, disregarding the attempts of opposition-fielded candidates in non-ST reserved seats, helped the BJP to win at least 20 seats and retain power. As the trick was exposed after the election results were declared, now the new slogan of religious incitement was raised to divide tribal society, he alleged.We also published the following articles recently Rights bodies oppose rally for delisting of converted tribalsCivil rights groups write letter to Jharkhand government, seeking vigilance and legal action against hate speeches at a rally organized by Janjanti Surakha Manch, an affiliate of RSS-backed Vanvashi Kalyan Kendra. The rally is demanding the removal of converted tribals from the Scheduled Tribes list. The groups allege that the rally is intended to create communal disharmony and divide tribals in the name of Sarna-Christianity. They express surprise at the government for granting permission for such a program.106243177 Party worried after Cong leader rallies against tribals delisting bidCongress faces challenge ahead of Lok Sabha elections as working president announces mega rally to counter bid to delist tribals converting to Christianity and Islam. Rally aimed at appeasing Christian tribals, but could upset tribal electorate who follow Sarna faith. State Congress insiders express concern over lack of consultation with JPCC's political affairs committee and working committee. JPCC working to tap into tribal voters to emerge from shadows of JMM. Former MLA Tirkey states rally not under party banner, invites like-minded tribal rights activist bodies. JPCC president Thakur states inability to comment on rally conducted on personal capacity.106335091 Tribals plan Delhi protest on delisting converts from ST listThousands of tribals from across India will converge in New Delhi in February to demand the removal of converted tribals from the ST list. The campaign is backed by the RSS and other Hindu groups. A recent rally in Ranchi, organized by the Janjati Suraksha Manch (JSM), saw 5000 tribals protesting against the social and financial advantages received by converted tribals. Supporters of de-listing argue that converted tribals receive support from foreign funds, reservation benefits, and government benefits as a religious minority. The JSM plans to hold the next rally in New Delhi, where tribals will demand reservation benefits for those who are genuinely deprived and following their traditional practices.106278286

organizations.name: agartala news - times of india agartala
bjp dividing tribal society on religious lines
